title: Frik Kirsten
text:
Frederick Barend Christoffel Kirsten (born ) is a former South African <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> professional footballer that played as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%231.%20Prop">prop</a>. He represented the in the international <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a> competition between 2009 and 2014 and the in the domestic <a href="Currie%20Cup">Currie Cup</a> and <a href="Vodacom%20Cup">Vodacom Cup</a> competitions between 2008 and 2013, making 81 first class appearances for the <a href="Pretoria">Pretoria</a>-based side.
After making his first class debut during the <a href="2008%20Vodacom%20Cup">2008 Vodacom Cup</a>, he made his <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a> debut against the in 2009 and his <a href="Currie%20Cup">Currie Cup</a> debut in 2009 against in the same year.
In 2013, he was called up to the squad following an injury to <a href="Frans%20Malherbe">Frans Malherbe</a>, but failed to make any appearances for the Springboks.
He announced his retirement in December 2014, aged 26, after suffering a neck injury in February of that year.
